page.title: 15RELIGION
page.content: The first monks to settle in Leyland were from{Penwortham Priory}and built{St Andrew's Church}in 1334.This in turn built daughter churches St James,St Ambrose and St John,all C.of E.The first R.C. church was built in 1845 by{Benedictine monks}.The new St Mary's R.C. church built in 1964,is circular with interesting statues by Arthur Dooley depicting stations of the cross and many symbolic features are incorporated in its design.There is an old Chalice dating from 1517 inscribed"Restore mee to Layland Lankeshire".Two{Methodist Chapels,}a {United Reform}church and buildings for {Jehovah's Witnesses}and {Pentecostalists}are also in the area.
